  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Mechanical Manager (Cement Mill)",
  "description": "Dangote Group is one of Nigeria&rsquo;s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard &ndash; earned reputation for excellent business practices and products&rsquo; quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Mechanical Manager (Cement Mill)

Job Location:&nbsp;Obajana, Kogi

Job Summary


	The Mechanical Manager (Cement Mill) at Dangote Cement Plc is responsible for the safe maintenance, repair or replacement of plant mechanical equipment and systems.
	Develop and implement mechanical maintenance strategy to ensure the achievement of critical maintenance metrics including Plant Availability and Overall Equipment Efficiency (OEE) of the Cement Mills.


Key Duties and Responsibilities


	Develop efficient and effective short and long term maintenance programs for cement mill.&nbsp;
	Coordinate regular mill inspections, assessments and adjustments, if necessary to ensure optimum availability of the cement mill and to verify that the mill operates within the load and stress parameters laid down.&nbsp;
	Plan, organise and schedule mechanical mill maintenance inspections, assessments and evaluations including spare part audits.&nbsp;
	Evaluate requirement of new machines or possible upgrade of existing machinery.&nbsp;
	Ensure that safety precautions are followed in installation, maintenance and working of mechanical element of the company.
	Prepare and monitor assigned budget items; ensure all work is done within stated budget.&nbsp;
	Operate computerised maintenance management systems for the effective maintenance of the cement factory.
	Perform any other duties as may be assigned by the Head, Mechanical Maintenance from time to time.&nbsp;


Requirements


	A Bachelor&rsquo;s degree or its equivalent in Mechanical Engineering or a related discipline.&nbsp;
	A minimum of thirteen (13) years of relevant plant related experience&nbsp;
	In-depth knowledge of preventative maintenance practices.&nbsp;
	In-depth knowledge of mechanical kiln maintenance in cement plant.
	Very good knowledge of safety standards as required by laws and regulations.
	Excellent time management, planning and scheduling skills.
	Very good analytical and problem solving skills.
	Very good oral, written communication and leadership skills.
	Proficient in the use of SAP &amp; Microsoft Office.&nbsp;


Benefits


	Private Health Insurance
	Paid Time Off
	Training &amp; Development.

Mechanical Manager (Cement Mill) Job at Dangote Group




        
    

        
        Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Mechanical Manager (Cement Mill)

Job Location: Obajana, Kogi

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Mechanical Manager (Cement Mill) at Dangote Cement Plc is responsible for the safe maintenance, repair or replacement of plant mechanical equipment and systems.
	Develop and implement mechanical maintenance strategy to ensure the achievement of critical maintenance metrics including Plant Availability and Overall Equipment Efficiency (OEE) of the Cement Mills.


Key Duties and Responsibilities


	Develop efficient and effective short and long term maintenance programs for cement mill. 
	Coordinate regular mill inspections, assessments and adjustments, if necessary to ensure optimum availability of the cement mill and to verify that the mill operates within the load and stress parameters laid down. 
	Plan, organise and schedule mechanical mill maintenance inspections, assessments and evaluations including spare part audits. 
	Evaluate requirement of new machines or possible upgrade of existing machinery. 
	Ensure that safety precautions are followed in installation, maintenance and working of mechanical element of the company.
	Prepare and monitor assigned budget items; ensure all work is done within stated budget. 
	Operate computerised maintenance management systems for the effective maintenance of the cement factory.
	Perform any other duties as may be assigned by the Head, Mechanical Maintenance from time to time. 


Requirements


	A Bachelor’s degree or its equivalent in Mechanical Engineering or a related discipline. 
	A minimum of thirteen (13) years of relevant plant related experience 
	In-depth knowledge of preventative maintenance practices. 
	In-depth knowledge of mechanical kiln maintenance in cement plant.
	Very good knowledge of safety standards as required by laws and regulations.
	Excellent time management, planning and scheduling skills.
	Very good analytical and problem solving skills.
	Very good oral, written communication and leadership skills.
	Proficient in the use of SAP & Microsoft Office. 


Benefits


	Private Health Insurance
	Paid Time Off
	Training & Development.
